verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
evaṁ carcita-saṅkalpo
bhagavān madhusūdanaḥ
āsasādātha caṇūraṁ
muṣṭtikaṁ rohiṇī-sutaḥ

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; evam—thus; saṅkalpaḥ—His determination; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; āsasāda—confronted; atha—then; cāṇūram—Cāṇūra; muṣṭikam—Muṣṭika; rohiṇī-sutaḥ—the son of Rohiṇī, Lord Balarāma.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Thus addressed, Lord Kṛṣṇa made up His mind to accept the challenge. He paired off with Cāṇūra, and Lord Balarāma with Muṣṭika.
